item.title: My Spanish Journey - Part 1
item.description:
For a while now, I have been wanting to learn a foreign language. However, I never actually dedicated any time to it. So finally, this year, I decided take it seriously and began learning Spanish.

Why choose Spanish of all the languages in the world, you ask? Partly because it is English-adjacent, making it much easier to learn compared to a language such as Japanese or Mandarin, which have their own writing systems. And partly because it is also one of the most spoken languages in the world.

item.title: Hello, World!
item.description:
Firstly, apologies for the cliched title. I just couldn’t resist 😺.

I have lost count of the number of times I have started a blog, only for me to give up on it later. And yet, here I am, trying once again. Well, somebody smart did once say —

“The definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over again, but expecting different results.”

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Hi there 👋

I am currently working as a Software Engineer III (L4) at Google as part of Feedback & Happiness Tracking Surveys (HaTS) team. These services are leveraged by partner teams across all Google products to collect user feedback and conduct product surveys.

Previously, I worked at Microsoft for almost 4 years in the Azure Functions and the Azure Container Apps teams.
